position.marginalia_text: Non viuitur discursibus, sed artibus. Vulgari studiorum modo, non itur ad

marginalia.translation: One does not live for discourses but for arts. In the common approach to studies, one does not go towards knowledge, but errs towards futility.

position.marginalia_text: Studere, vt vulgares isti scholastici; non procedere, sed vagari est; non proficere, sed confundere.

marginalia.translation: To study, as those vulgar scholastics, is not to advance, but to wander; not to accomplish, but to bewilder.
Little pills, without which there is nothing.

position.marginalia_text: Pla[e]riq[ue] docti terunt a[e]tatem, et operam perdunt in varijs eiusdem rei scriptoribus, commentarijs, discursibus, infinitis libroru[m] nugis. Mihi non est opus discursibus: sed uel ipsis artibus, philosophia, professionibus in quotidiam praxi: vel arcanis, stratagematis, technis
Oeconomicis in esse: vel saltem gnomis, apophthegmatis, prouerbijs, epimythijs, epigrammatis,
salibus, qui verè sales. In talibus sententiaru[m], reru[m], operu[m] articulis, nulla temporis
iactura: { Nulla liberalis educatio, Sine Liberalium artium institutione: quicq[ui]d
posteà profitendum, aut negociandum. Propriaru[m] omnium facultatum ille communis apparatus. Et sine hoc generali instructu, qua[e]uis deficit specialis pro[fe]ssio?

marginalia.translation: Many learned people wear out with age and ruin the work of the same matter in various authors, commentaries, discourses, and infinite trifles of books. For me, discourses are not useful: but either the arts themselves, philosophy, and the professions in their daily praxis; or for secrets, stratagems, and economic artifices in their being: or at least sayings, aphorisms, proverbs, aftertales, epigrams, and witticisms which truely are witty. In such points of opinions, matters, and works, there is no waste of time: there is no education of gentlemanliness without the institution of honorable arts, whatever is to be completed or carried out afterwards. That common preparation of all proper skills. And without this general instruction, is any special profession left wanting?
